ai.summary: The Boundary Walk is an 11.6 km moderate hike in the UK that follows historic field boundaries along rural paths, offering varied scenery, gentle elevation, and a steady pace.
ai.terrain_summary: The route features undulating countryside with a mix of compact gravel tracks, grassy paths, and occasional muddy sections. Expect uneven surfaces, stiles, hedgerows, and some exposed sections after rain; waterproof footwear and careful footing are advised.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for changeable UK weather: check the forecast and daylight hours before you start. Wear sturdy, waterproof footwear and dress in layers. Carry a map or GPS, a fully charged phone, water, snacks, and a small first aid kit. Stay on marked paths, close gates behind you, and be mindful of livestock. If venturing on exposed sections, take extra care in windy conditions and avoid the route in severe weather.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Water bottle or hydration system (at least 1–2 liters)
Map and compass or GPS device
Phone with offline maps and a portable power bank
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) for longer daylight and generally drier conditions. The route can be tackled in winter with appropriate gear, but expect mud, wind, and reduced daylight.

seo.title: Boundary Walk – 11.6 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Plan your Boundary Walk: a 11.6 km moderate hike in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety tips, best seasons, and essential gear for a successful day on the trail.
